intro: Lophostephus, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. These plants are characterized by their fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. Lophostephus species typically grow in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in warm, humid environments. They are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and vibrant blooms. The genus includes several species, with Lophostephus campanulatus being one of the most well-known.
